meanings.definition: Existing or occurring outside the natural world
meanings.sent1: The idea of ghosts is extramundane to many people.
meanings.sent2: The concept of aliens is often considered extramundane.
meanings.sent3: The notion of talking animals is extramundane but entertaining in fairy tales.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination soared to extramundane heights as she wrote her science fiction novel.
meanings.sent5: The mystical aura of the forest felt extramundane under the moonlight.

meanings.definition: Beyond the physical world or universe
meanings.sent1: The belief in parallel universes is an extramundane concept.
meanings.sent2: Philosophers often ponder about extramundane realms.
meanings.sent3: The idea of time travel to the future is extramundane yet fascinating.
meanings.sent4: His dreams took him to an extramundane realm where anything was possible.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted an extramundane landscape beyond human comprehension.

meanings.sent1: The monk's teachings focused on achieving extramundane enlightenment.
meanings.sent2: Yoga aims to connect the mind with extramundane spiritual energy.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks seemed extramundane, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her music had an extramundane quality that touched the souls of listeners.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved with extramundane grace, captivating everyone in the room.
